main event: A round and oval object was observed in the sky near Rossburg, Ohio on August 9, 1966.
interesting points: The object was stationary and faded out of view after being observed through binoculars., It emitted no sound and left no trail or distortion., The sighting lasted for a considerable period of time, estimated at 10 minutes., The observer described the object as reddish white & white in color., It was concluded that the object might be the star Capella.
sighted object: round and oval object in the sky
witness description: The witness observed the object through binoculars from a distance.
